title: Gaussian Elimination Quiz
description: Test your understanding of Gaussian elimination and solving systems of linear equations.

questions.question: What is the first step in Gaussian elimination?
options: Write the system as an augmented matrix
questions.explanation: Gaussian elimination begins by representing the system of equations as an augmented matrix.

questions.question: Which row operation is NOT allowed in Gaussian elimination?
options: Multiply a row by a non-zero scalar
Add a multiple of one row to another row
questions.explanation: You can multiply a row by a scalar, add multiples of rows, and swap rows, but you cannot multiply two rows together.

questions.question: What does it mean when you get a row like [0 0 0 | 5] in Gaussian elimination?
options: The system has infinitely many solutions
The system has a unique solution
questions.explanation: A row [0 0 0 | 5] means 0x + 0y + 0z = 5, which is 0 = 5, an impossible equation indicating an inconsistent system.

questions.question: In which form should the matrix be for back-substitution?
questions.explanation: After forward elimination, the matrix should be in upper triangular form (also called row echelon form) for back-substitution.
